    • Method Detail

      • addWallet

        public void addWallet(Map<String,Object> params,
             ISirqulCallback<SirqulResponse> callback)
        Adds an offer to the wallet. If type VOUCHER then attempts to purchase, otherwise it is just added to the wallet directly.

        Target API Endpoint: /wallet/create

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          the account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required)
        • SirqulKeys.offerId
          The id of the offer being added (offerId or offeLocationId required)
        • SirqulKeys.offerLocationId
          the offer location id to add
        • SirqulKeys.usePoints
          if a voucher and set to true then use points, otherwise use credit card on file

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        a SirqulResponse with a message of success or fail
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        WalletObject.addWallet

      • getOfferTransaction

        public void getOfferTransaction(Map<String,Object> params,
                       ISirqulCallback<OfferTransactionResponse> callback)
        Gets the offer transaction.

        Target API Endpoint: /wallet/get

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          the account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required, deviceId sent automatically)
        • SirqulKeys.transactionId
          the offer transaction id to get details of
        • SirqulKeys.includeMission
          if true then include mission data, false to not include
        • SirqulKeys.location of type Location
          the location of the user
        • SirqulKeys.returnFullResponse
          indicator to return the full response

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        OfferTransactionResponse on successful response, SirqulResponse on error.
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        WalletObject.getOfferTransaction

      • removeWallet

        public void removeWallet(Map<String,Object> params,
                ISirqulCallback<SirqulResponse> callback)
        Removes the transaction from the wallet by setting the deleted date to the current date/time. Requires a valid account and transactionId.

        Target API Endpoint: /wallet/delete

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          the account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required)
        • SirqulKeys.transactionId
          the offer transaction id to remove

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        a SirqulResponse with a message of success or fail
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.

        WalletObject.removeWallet

      • searchWalletOffers

        public void searchWalletOffers(Map<String,Object> params,
                      ISirqulCallback<SearchResponse<OfferTransactionResponse>> callback)
        Gets all of the active offers currently in the wallet. This will not return already redeemed offers.

        Target API Endpoint: /wallet/search

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          the account id
        • SirqulKeys.keyword
          The keyword to search for
        • SirqulKeys.retailerId
          Filter results for this retailer
        • SirqulKeys.retailerLocationId
          Filter results for this retailer location
        • SirqulKeys.offerId
          Filter results for this offer
        • SirqulKeys.offerLocationId
          Filter results for this offer location
        • SirqulKeys.offerType
          Filter results to only return COUPON or VOUCHER offers
        • SirqulKeys.sortField
          Determines what to sort the results by {CREATED, UPDATED, SEARCH_TAGS, ACTIVE, ACTIVATED, EXPIRES, TITLE, SUBTITLE, OFFER_TYPE, SPECIAL_OFFER_TYPE, OFFER_VISIBILITY, CUSTOMER_ID, CUSTOMER_DISPLAY, RETAILER_ID, RETAILER_NAME, RETAILER_LOCATION_ID, RETAILER_LOCATION_NAME, BILLABLE_ENTITY_ID, BILLABLE_ENTITY_NAME, RESPONSIBLE_DISPLAY}
        • SirqulKeys.descending
          Determines whether the results are in descending order
        • SirqulKeys.start
          The start index for pagination
        • SirqulKeys.limit
          The limit for pagination
        • SirqulKeys.location of type Location
          the location of the user
        • SirqulKeys.redeemed
          if true return redeemed transactions (status 2), otherwise return active transactions (status 0 or 1)

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        SearchResponse<OfferTransactionResponse> on valid response, or SirqulResponse with error message
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        WalletObject.searchWalletOffers

      • updateWalletOfferStatus

        public void updateWalletOfferStatus(Map<String,Object> params,
                           ISirqulCallback<OfferResponse> callback)
        Update wallet offer status. The status values are: 0 - not redeemable, 1 - redeemable, 2- redeemed. Not redeemable means the customer has received the offer but has not decided to use (or print) it yet. Until they choose to do this the merchant cannot redeem the offer (has not been given permission yet). Redeemable means the customer has chosen to use the offer and wishes to redeem it. Redeemed means the merchant has accepted the offer and the given the customer its value, then marked it a used in the system.

        Target API Endpoint: /wallet/update

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          the account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required)
        • SirqulKeys.transactionId
          the offer transaction id to remove
        • SirqulKeys.offerLocationId
          the offer location id
        • SirqulKeys.usePoints
          the use points
        • SirqulKeys.status
          the status value to change to (0 or 1)
        • SirqulKeys.location of type Location
          the location of the current user
        • SirqulKeys.returnFullResponse
          Indicates to return full response

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        a OfferResponse or SirqulResponse with a message of fail
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        WalletObject.updateWalletOfferStatus
